data.author: Greg Lockwood

changelog.release_notes:
- Added settings dialog to pick the visible units. Now you can hide the ones you don't use.
- Improved startup time. Unfortunately it still needs to be connected to the phone, though.
- Improved formatting of numbers. Bigger numbers now use "k" to mean "thousand" and "mil" to mean "million".
- Added Feet <-> Nautical Mile conversion (need to enable in settings first). Aviation enthusiasts rejoice! Thanks to Simon for the suggestion.

Added Calories to Kilojoules conversion.
Fixed bug with Celsius to Fahrenheit conversion formula. Big thanks to Christian Montes for reporting this bug.

Added Fahrenheit to Celsius conversion.
Menus might be a little faster, since they are created as needed instead of all upfront.

Initial version with 2 conversions supported:

Miles <-> Kilometres
Pounds <-> Kilograms

data.description:
Simple imperial to metric conversion app that allows you to quickly convert between units by drilling down in menus until you find a value of sufficient accuracy.

So the less precision you require, the fewer number of button presses you need!

Currently supported conversions:

Miles <-> Kilometres
Pounds <-> Kilograms
Fahrenheit <-> Celsius
Calories <-> Kilojoules
Feet <-> (International) Nautical Miles*

* Hidden by default. Enable in Settings.

Basic settings dialog allows you to customise which conversions are shown, so you can hide the ones you don't use.

More units will be added as I find a need for them or they are requested.

Note that this is written in Pebble.js, so unfortunately it is slower than it could be, and requires a connection to the phone. I do have plans to do a new version at some point in C so it runs completely on the watch, but it is proving to be more difficult than I anticipated. Help would be very welcome.
